author: dkbit98
created_time: April 21, 2023, 01:00:55 AMLast edit: May 19, 2023, 02:04:12 PM by dkbit98
content: Did you know that you can purchase almost anything from Japan, pay with Bitcoin, and receive ordered items worldwide?I am not advertising website called Zenmarket but I recently found out they are using CoinGate service that accepts Bitcoin, litecoin, ethereum and other altcoins for payment.They accept fiat payments with cards, wire transfer, paypal, and they have very reasonable fees that looks much cheaper than other alternative proxy buying websites that ship stuff from Japan.I see services working with Zenmarket are Rakuten, Amazon, Y! Auctions, Y! Shopping, Rakuma and Mercari.Bitcoin is deposited to your account and then converted to Japanese Yen - ¥  (¥ 1 =  $0.0075)QuoteIn April 2020, we started accepting Cryptocurrency payments via the CoinGate payment gateway. At this time Bitcoin, Litecoin, Ethereum and 45 more virtual and blockchain currencies are available for depositing funds.https://zenmarket.jp/en/payment.aspx#Payment%20methods%20and%20feesAnyone used Zenmarket website with Bitcoin so far and what was your experience? Or there are some better alternative?Code:https://zenmarket.jpSecond website from Japan accepting Bitcoin I found is Shoppinginjapan and they are offering 2% discount for purchasing with Bitcoin:Code:https://www.shoppinginjapan.net/Note that topic is self moderated to avoid spam.

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: It looks like a Japanese Aliexpress clone, that is not saying just the website design, but also the kind of products being offered for sale. Many of them are the kind of things other users would sell on AliExpress. For example, I searched for Nintendo Switch and I got results for various switch parts/titles but dubious results for the console itself.

comments.created_time: April 25, 2023, 07:13:59 AMLast edit: April 25, 2023, 01:44:03 PM by Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: Don Pedro Dinero on April 25, 2023, 04:14:15 AMI would be interested to know if when they send you the items, they enclose an invoice with the bitcoin payment, which would not be very convenient in terms of privacy, as customs usually open the envelopes to see what is there.Since they are using payment processor, they don't even deal with bitcoin and instead CoinGate does that part for them so in the end you pay with bitcoin and Zenmarket gets fiat. comments.body: Quote from: ChuckBuck on May 02, 2023, 02:00:06 AMoh, I just came across the site and there are a few products that are reasonably priced compared to what I can buy where I live right now. Maybe I'll try to buy it in the future.but first of all, if you already have a buying experience, can you give me some information about shipping cost and delivery time? How long does it take to receive the item you want?Sure I can.There are multiple shipping options available for different regions, and exact fees depend on size of the item/s you ordered.Great thing that you can order several items, they will pack it all in one box, measure size, weight and tell you exact fees you should pay.You can also calculate estimated shipping fees manually using their Shipping Calculator, but don't forget to include Zenmarket fees also. Shiping can be very cheap using AVIA Airmail (Small) if your package weight is less than 2 kg (4.4 lb) with total dimensions are maximum 90 cm (35.4 inch) Length(a) + height(b) + depth(c), and if you don't need express delivery.Slowest delivery is Surface but it's not always the cheapest option, and there is also UPS, FedEx, DHL, EMS and Zen Express.Delivery time depends on your location and can be from few days to few weeks.PSNote that now is Golden Week holiday time in Japan, so many services don't work as usual.
